@Ignore.description: Ignores the test. You can use this annotation when you are still working on a code, the test case is not ready to run, or if the execution time of test is too long to be included.

@Test method.description: A method that is a test method

@Setup method.description: Executes the method before each test. This annotation prepares the test environment such as reading input data or initializing the class.

@Before method.description: Executes the method once per class, before the start of all tests. This annotation can be used to perform time-sensitive activities such as connecting to a database.

@TearDown method.description: Executes the method after each test. This annotation cleans up the test environment such as deleting temporary data or restoring defaults.

@After method.description: Executes the method once, after all the tests are executed. This annotation is used to perform clean-up activities such as disconnecting from a database.

@Test exception method.description: Fails the test if the method does not throw the exception mentioned in the expected attribute.
